title: Ticket #3220: Allow different submit limits for grid resources
description:
Many groups would like to be able to set different job submission limits (i.e. GRIDMANAGER_MAX_SUBMITTED_JOBS_PER_RESOURCE) for different remote servers. There is code in the gridmanager to allow this, but it's been broken for a long time. We could get it working pretty easily.

The revived old syntax works like this: 

GRIDMANAGER_MAX_SUBMITTED_JOBS_PER_RESOURCE=5,foo.edu,10,bar.org,15

It's a comma-separated list. The first entry is the default limit. Each subsequent pair of entries are a hostname and the limit for that hostname. The gridmanager does a substring match of the hostname field against the name returned by BaseResource::ResourceName(). ResourceName() returns a modified form of the second field of the GridResource attribute.
